items.summary: England go down to a humbling defeat in the first Ashes Test after Travis Headâ€™s blistering century completes an astonishing Australia fightback in Perth.

items.title: Nice guy Edwards out to prove he won't finish last with Wolves
items.summary: After 111 appearances as a player for Wolves, news manager Rob Edwards takes charge against Crystal Palace with the club battling for their Premier League lives.

items.title: 'Where has this come from?' - Pope, Brook & Root dismissed
items.summary: Scott Boland and Mitchell Starc take the three wickets of Ollie Pope, Harry Brook and Joe Root in the space of six balls as England fall to 76-5 on day two of the first Ashes Test in Perth.

items.title: Samsung reshuffles its leadership, TM Roh gets even more important
items.summary: Today, Samsung Electronics named TM Roh as head of its Device eXperience (DX) Division and appointed him as CEO. He won't be the only CEO, however - he's joining Young Hyun Jun, Vice Chairman and Head of the Device Solutions (DS) Division, as co-CEO. Roh will continue to oversee the company's mobilâ€¦

items.title: Why it was always Arsenal for 'part-time barista' Saka
items.summary: England winger Bukayo Saka sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about his love for Arsenal and living in his "coffee era".

items.title: North London derby is one of most beautiful games - Saka
items.summary: Bukayo Saka shares what it was like growing up as an Arsenal fan and what the north London derby means to him.

items.title: Starc takes catch off own bowling to remove Crawley for another duck
items.summary: England's second innings gets off to a familiar start as Mitchell Starc's "brilliant" diving catch dismisses Zak Crawley for a duck in the first over again on day two of the first Ashes Test in Perth.

items.title: England lead by 40 after taking final Australian wicket
items.summary: Ben Duckett takes the catch at gully to dismiss Nathan Lyon for four, as Australia are bowled out for 132 to give England a lead of 40 runs heading into the second innings on day two of the first Ashes Test in Perth.

items.title: Samsung Galaxy A57 runs Geekbench with the Exynos 1680 chipset on board
items.summary: Samsung launched the Galaxy A56 in March, and the company is now working on its successor, the Galaxy A57. A prototype A57 ran Geekbench earlier today, and, as always, this has revealed the chipset that's powering it. [#InlinePriceWidget,13603,1#] It's the Exynos 1680, the successor to the Exynos 1â€¦

items.title: Moto G Stylus (2026) design revealed in leaked live images
items.summary: Motorolaâ€™s upcoming G Stylus smartphone has surfaced online in leaked images. The Moto G Stylus (2026), expected to launch soon, will join the Moto G (2026) and Moto G Play (2026), which were unveiled earlier this month. Leaked live images of the phone show a design thatâ€™s similar to the G Stylus (â€¦

items.title: Carpenter, Rolfo & Bartel feature in UWCL goals of week
items.summary: Strikes from Ellie Carpenter, Fridolina Rolfo and Julia Bartel all feature in the best goals of the week from the Women's Champions League.

items.title: World number one Thitikul three clear at Tour Championship
items.summary: World number one Jeeno Thitikul cards a nine-under-par 63 to open up a three-shot lead at the CME Group Tour Championship.

items.title: Wales aim to end 72 years of agony against All Blacks
items.summary: The history of matches between two nations that bleed rugby is almost a history of the game itself.

Itâ€™s the most wonderful time of the year, but it can also be the most exhausting. Between hunting for gifts and getting the house ready for guests, itâ€™s easy to get overwhelmed. items.title: Littler wins as Van Veen comeback stuns Humphries
items.summary: Luke Littler wins his first match as world number one to progress at the Players Championship Finals, while Gian van Veen produces a stunning comeback to knock out Luke Humphries.

items.title: Man Utd might offload Fernandes - Saturday's gossip
items.summary: Manchester United might offload Bruno Fernandes to aid a summer rebuild, Barcelona are keen on Harry Kane, Real Madrid look at Angelo Stiller, plus more.
